it.polimi.ingsw.GC_32.Common.Network

Class GameMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.GC_32.Common.Network.GameMessage

  • public class GameMessage
extends java.lang.Object
    GameMessage is the way the server represent interally the messages which must be sent to the client or which are received from the client. A GameMessage contains not only the message sent by the client but the UUID of the player who sent the message, the game UUID of the message, the type of message sent, and a flag which tells if the message must be sent in broadcast or not.
    • broadcast: if set true, the message must be sent to all the client connected to the game
    • gameID: the UUID of the game
    • message: the JsonValue representing the message sent by the client
    • opcode: string representing the type of message received
    • playerID: the UUID of the player who has sent the message
    note that GameMessages are never sent throught the network. Server and client only communicates by string.
